availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles H. Wickliffe (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, assistant marshal)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, assistant marshal. Virginia native. Married to Louisa Wickliffe. Father of Susanna Wickliffe, Mary Wickliffe, Virginia Wickliffe, James Wickliffe, Charles Wickliffe, Drusilla Wickliffe, and Edmund Wickliffe. Resident of Lexington in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Lexington in 1840. Constable in Lexington in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Lexington in 1850. Assistant marshal in Lexington in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 457B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 271A.
